title: WATCH || Behind-the-scenes at Alabama
text:
â€” KYwildcatsTV (@KYwildcatsTV) February 13, 2017 
KY Wildcats TV takes you behind-the-scenes of Kentucky's win at Alabama Saturday. 
The Wildcats (20-5, 10-2 SEC) led by as many as 18 in the second half before holding off the Crimson Tide (14-10, 7-5) for a much-needed 67-58 victory. 
It marked UK's seventh straight win over Alabama and third straight at Coleman Coliseum in Tuscaloosa, matching the longest streak in school history. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
The Crimson Tide's 20 first half points were the fewest surrendered by Kentucky this season. 
Malik Monk led the way with 17 points and two of UK's three three-pointers as the Wildcats became the first school to reach 1,000 straight games with a made three. 
Bam Adebayo added 14 points and seven rebounds before fouling out and Isaiah Briscoe turned in a double-double with 11 points and 11 rebounds as he scored seven points over the final 4:24 to help stave off Alabama. Author
